body_html:
According to our build instance specs we're building on Intel Xeon Platinum 8000-series processors none of which do not support AVX2. So this can't be the problem.

The test instance cpu also supports AVX2.

So the error must be somewhere else.
body_text:
According to our build instance specs we're building on Intel Xeon Platinum 8000-series processors none of which do not support AVX2. So this can't be the problem.
The test instance cpu also supports AVX2.
So the error must be somewhere else.
body:
According to [our build instance specs](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/now-available-compute-intensive-c5-instances-for-amazon-ec2/) we're building on Intel Xeon Platinum 8000-series processors [none of which](https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/products/processors/xeon/scalable/platinum-processors.html) do not support AVX2. So this can't be the problem.

The [test instance](https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/instance-types/g3/) cpu [also supports AVX2](https://ark.intel.com/products/91317/Intel-Xeon-Processor-E5-2699-v4-55M-Cache-2_20-GHz). 

So the error must be somewhere else.
